Headline: Green Line Delays, Limited Service Between Garfield & Cottage Grove
ShortDescription: Green Line service experiencing delays; limited service via train shuttle available btwn Cottage Grove & Garfield

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Green Line trains are experiencing delays due to a shortage of available staff. We are working to run as much service as frequently and as evenly as possible.

Currently, trains are operating in two sections:

  • between Harlem/Lake and Ashland/63rd, and,
  • between Garfield station and Cottage Grove, with limited service.

For service to Cottage Grove, exit at Garfield and board the shuttle train on the Harlem-bound side of the platform.

See station personnel for further assistance and pay attention to announcements on trains and at stations for service information.

We are working to restore service as quickly as possible. Allow extra travel time.

Headline: Green Line Service Running with Delays
ShortDescription: Green Line trains are running w/delays from Hrlm & both 63rd terminals due to temp shortage of staff. Shuttle buses are available from Garfield to 63rd/Cott Grv

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?

Green Line trains are running with delays from Harlem and both 63rd terminals due to a temporary shortage of available staff.

  • Shuttle buses are available from Garfield to 63rd/Cottage Grove to provide connecting service in both directions.

At this time, our operations staff are working to run as much service as frequently and manage service to be spaced as evenly as possible.

Consider other service alternatives that may serve your trip, such as nearby bus routes, or using buses to other rail lines.

 Allow extra travel time.
